podfile:
# Uncomment this line to define a global platform for your project
platform :ios, '12.0'

# CocoaPods analytics sends network stats synchronously affecting flutter build latency.
ENV['COCOAPODS_DISABLE_STATS'] = 'true'

project 'Runner', {
  'Debug' => :debug,
  'Profile' => :release,
  'Release' => :release,
}

def flutter_root
  generated_xcode_build_settings_path = File.expand_path(File.join('..', 'Flutter', 'Generated.xcconfig'), __FILE__)
  unless File.exist?(generated_xcode_build_settings_path)
    raise "#{generated_xcode_build_settings_path} must exist. If you're running pod install manually, make sure flutter pub get is executed first"
  end

  File.foreach(generated_xcode_build_settings_path) do |line|
    matches = line.match(/FLUTTER_ROOT\=(.*)/)
    return matches[1].strip if matches
  end
  raise "FLUTTER_ROOT not found in #{generated_xcode_build_settings_path}. Try deleting Generated.xcconfig, then run flutter pub get"
end

require File.expand_path(File.join('packages', 'flutter_tools', 'bin', 'podhelper'), flutter_root)

flutter_ios_podfile_setup

target 'Runner' do
  use_frameworks!
  use_modular_headers!

  flutter_install_all_ios_pods File.dirname(File.realpath(__FILE__))
end

post_install do |installer|
  installer.pods_project.targets.each do |target|
    flutter_additional_ios_build_settings(target)
    target.build_configurations.each do |config|
          config.build_settings['ENABLE_BITCODE'] = 'NO'
          config.build_settings['SWIFT_VERSION'] = '5.0'
        end
  end
end

title: Soft keyboard pops up at any external hardware keyboard key press

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample see "Code sample" section below)
2. Connect an external hardware keyboard
3. Type something on the keyboard

**Expected results:** No flashing soft keyboard

**Actual results:** Flashing soft keyboard that triggers MediaQuery at every key press since the soft keyboard changes the screen size

Here's a video that shows the problem:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6929765/161416206-79e1a7da-26a9-4a7a-9063-ac5208b98248.mp4

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter TextField issue',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyScreen(title: 'Flutter TextField issue'),
    );
  }
}

class MyScreen extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyScreen({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyScreen> createState() => _MyScreenState();
}

class _MyScreenState extends State<MyScreen> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: const TextField(),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

title: horizontal white line in the bottom of my custom app bar on Android

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Steps to Reproduce

So I am trying to make a custom reusable appbar widget like this

```
class MyCustomAppBar extends StatelessWidget implements PreferredSizeWidget {
  const MyCustomAppBar({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    final primaryColor = Theme.of(context).primaryColor;
    return AppBar(
      backgroundColor: primaryColor,
      elevation: 0, // to remove drop shadow
      titleSpacing: 0, // to remove extra padding on appbar left side
      title: Text("This Is appbar Title"),
    );
  }

  @override
  Size get preferredSize => const Size.fromHeight(50.0);
}
```

and then I use it on my scaffold like this

```
class NotificationListPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const NotificationListPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: MyCustomAppBar(),
      body: Column(
        children: [
          Container(
            width: double.infinity,
            height: 100,
            color: Theme.of(context).primaryColor,
            child: Center(
              child: Text(
                "this is container that has the same color with appbar",
                style: TextStyle(
                  fontSize: 10,
                ),
              ),
            ),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

and here is the result: https://i.stack.imgur.com/ZvTZ0.png

as you can see, there is a white horizontal line between the appbar and the container inside the column. and it will only apppear on Android, in iOS everything is ok as I expect.

If I change the Scaffold background color to be red, then that horizontal line will turn to be red as well.

I need to make a custom reusable widget. If I implement directly (without widget separation) like the code below, that horizontal line will not appear
```

class NotificationListPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const NotificationListPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(context) {
    final primaryColor = Theme.of(context).primaryColor;
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar( // I don't want to implement it directly like this. I want separate Appbar widget
        backgroundColor: primaryColor,
        elevation: 0, // to remove drop shadow
        titleSpacing: 0, // to remove extra padding on appbar left side
        title: Text("This Is appbar Title"),
      ),
      body: Column(
        children: [
          Container(
            width: double.infinity,
            height: 100,
            color: Theme.of(context).primaryColor,
            child: Center(
              child: Text(
                "this is container that has the same color with appbar",
                style: TextStyle(
                  fontSize: 10,
                ),
              ),
            ),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

**Expected results:** 

I expect there is no horizontal below my app bar if make a custom app bar widget. I expect I don't need to change the scaffold background color to remove that horizontal line

**Actual results:** 
I see horizontal line below my custom app bar

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>


```
class MyCustomAppBar extends StatelessWidget implements PreferredSizeWidget {
  const MyCustomAppBar({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    final primaryColor = Theme.of(context).primaryColor;
    return AppBar(
      backgroundColor: primaryColor,
      elevation: 0, // to remove drop shadow
      titleSpacing: 0, // to remove extra padding on appbar left side
      title: Text("This Is appbar Title"),
    );
  }

  @override
  Size get preferredSize => const Size.fromHeight(50.0);
}

class NotificationListPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const NotificationListPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: MyCustomAppBar(),
      body: Column(
        children: [
          Container(
            width: double.infinity,
            height: 100,
            color: Theme.of(context).primaryColor,
            child: Center(
              child: Text(
                "this is container that has the same color with appbar",
                style: TextStyle(
                  fontSize: 10,
                ),
              ),
            ),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

</details>

title: `prefer_final_parameters` lint error in `generated_plugin_registrant.dart`

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

1. enable `prefer_final_parameters` in `analysis_options.yaml`:
    ```yaml
    linter:
        rules:
            prefer_final_parameters: true
    ```
2. run `dart analyze`

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
no error, as it's a generated file that should never trigger any lint errors

either `final` should be added to the `registrar` parameter, or the rule should be ignored like the others

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
```
   info - Prefer final for parameter declarations if they are not reassigned -
          lib\generated_plugin_registrant.dart:13:22 - prefer_final_parameters
```

title: using FocusNode.requestFocus() on a TextField does not prevent the keyboard from disappearing unless a delay is used

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Tap on the TextField
3. Tap on "done" on your keyboard (or its equivalent)
4. The keyboard disappears, but the blue line below the TextField remains.
5. Now uncomment the line `await Future.delayed(const Duration(milliseconds: 1));` between `myFocusNode.unfocus();` and `requestFocus();`
6. Tap on the TextField
7. Tap on 'done' again

This issue is also referenced at #33305 but the issue has been closed with no apparent resolution.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
I expected the keyboard to just remain in place, without moving, and without having to use a `await Future.delayed()`

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Using the `await Future.delayed()`, the keyboard remains, but there is some glitchy visual animations of the keyboard disappearing for a moment and the textfield moving up and down.

**Edit:**
I've noted that the amount of time used for the delay seems to vary as I develop my app, and so far I've seen cases where 10 milliseconds is insufficient and the keyboard still disappears, but it's "fixed" by increasing the duration of the delay. Maybe the `FocusNode.unfocus()` function should be asynchronous so we can `await` for it or something?

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main(List<String> args) {
  runApp(const MaterialApp(
    home: MyApp(),
  ));
}

class MyApp extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  State<MyApp> createState() => _MyAppState();
}

class _MyAppState extends State<MyApp> {
  late FocusNode myFocusNode;

  @override
  void initState() {
    myFocusNode = FocusNode();
    super.initState();
  }

  @override
  void dispose() {
    myFocusNode.dispose();
    super.dispose();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      body: Padding(
        padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
        child: Center(
          child: TextField(
            focusNode: myFocusNode,
            onSubmitted: (string) async {
              myFocusNode.unfocus();
              await Future.delayed(const Duration(milliseconds: 1));
              myFocusNode.requestFocus();
            },
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--
      Run your application with `flutter run --verbose` and attach all the
      log output below between the lines with the backticks. If there is an
      exception, please see if the error message includes enough information
      to explain how to solve the issue.
-->

`flutter run --verbose` logs is too long to fit here or in a pastebin

```

```

<!--
     Run `flutter analyze` and attach any output of that command below.
     If there are any analysis errors, try resolving them before filing this issue.
-->

title: FR: Column & Row widget: add `spacing` (similar to Wrap one)

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Use case

I would like the `Column` and `Row` widgets to have a `spacing` parameter that would work exactly the same as in `Wrap`, so that information could be easily displayed by adding a certain space between each child node of the widget.

## Proposal

Simply add a new attribute `spacing` to `Column` and `Row` that defaults to `0` to preserve current default behaviour.

body:
Command
```
flutter drive --dart-define=app.flavor=develop --driver=lib/integration_test/test_driver.dart --target=lib/integration_test/scenarios/user_actions_test.dart -d web-server --driver-port=9515
```

Steps to Reproduce
1. install chrom and chrome driver 99
2. start test

title: [web] [CanavasKit] Font fallback in CanavasKit does not support Unicode characters outside the BMP (Basic Multilingual Plane)

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Fallback font for characters outside the BMP like "𥻨" (U+25EE8) can not be found, and this log is printed.

```
Could not find a set of Noto fonts to display all missing characters. Please add a font asset for the missing characters. See: https://flutter.dev/docs/cookbook/design/fonts
```

I can see that every font‘s supported CodeunitRange are listed here.
https://github.com/flutter/engine/blob/main/lib/web_ui/lib/src/engine/canvaskit/font_fallbacks.dart#L630
And almost none of them contains characters outside the BMP.

But actually NotoSansJP supports the character above (maybe some other fonts support it too), and it shows properly if I bundle the font file of NotoSansJP in my app.

title: Execution of the command buffer was aborted due to an error during execution. Caused GPU Timeout Error

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
I would like to re open #97910 as it is still happening despite no UI logic is impacted or reloaded when app state becomes inactive.
 
I only send 6 `http` requests inside this method, and there is no warning in the Flutter documentation or anywhere else that we should not do that.

If we should not, i would like to know what are the limitations please because the buffer of all my iPhone's GPU seems overloaded when the app is swiped up to go to the `App Switcher` on iOS.  
This has for effect to completely freeze the phone's UI which is highly undesirable.

Thanks for your understanding

title: [Web] can't make register form where chrome will recognize username(email)

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Clone https://github.com/matanshukry/tmp-ex-login
2. Run the example: `flutter run -d chrome`
3. Click the `Create Account` button (looks like link)
4. Enter random details, e.g. email `matanshukry@gmail.com`, password `Aa123456`
5. Optional: Click the `SIGN UP` button.
6. Click the "key" icon in the url bar on chrome browser. That will allow you to check what chrome currently detects as username/password.
7. You can see the password is correctly filled, but the username is blank.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5613042/160238001-8c5740ce-eed2-4ef5-9cea-cb087301b3c3.png)

Note: step 5 is optional because the validation can be seen both before and after submitting the form.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
The username should be filled. That is, the fields should be set in a way that allow chrome to correctly detect and use the username field.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Chrome can't detect the username field. I tried to add `autofillHints`, which successfully added some details to the input, but the result is the same.

title: [webview_flutter] Expose the allowsLinkPreview property in WKWebView for iOS

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Use case

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

I am using the WebView widget in my application and have noticed that users can long-press links to get a preview, aka, peek and pop view (iOS only feature):
![Simulator Screen Recording - iPhone 13 - 2022-03-25 at 17 17 57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/877327/160169909-63893694-b4be-42e5-87b2-d63331ae8df5.gif)


I would like to have control over what WebViews have this property enabled on iOS.

This can be set by using the [allowsLinkPreview](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/webkit/wkwebview/1415000-allowslinkpreview) boolean property on WKWebview.

Some other packages do expose this property like [flutter_inappwebview](https://pub.dev/documentation/flutter_inappwebview/latest/flutter_inappwebview/IOSInAppWebViewOptions/allowsLinkPreview.html) - [allowsLinkPreview](https://pub.dev/documentation/flutter_inappwebview/latest/flutter_inappwebview/IOSInAppWebViewOptions/allowsLinkPreview.html)

However, I feel this is a foundational level functionality for webviews on iOS and noticed that flutter_webviews package doesn't expose this property but does expose other iOS only properties like `gestureNavigationEnabled`.

## Proposal

<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

In a similar manner to the `gestureNavigationEnabled` property I was going to propose adding `allowsLinkPreview` and passing that through to the native WKWebView set up.

title: Android Autofill not working on latest stable (2.10.3)

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Autofill is not working when using 2.10.3 (also didn't work for 2.10.1) especially when I use `AutofillHints.creditCardNumber` `AutofillHints.address` and so on. `AutofillHints.name` works fine. This problem was also reported in another issue, but it's still not solved although the issue was closed and release notes also mentions it as resolved in 2.10.1.
older issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94043 / https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/98112

title: Showmodalbottomsheet has obvious jamming when running for the first time

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Details Showmodalbottomsheet has obvious jamming when the app is installed and run for the first time, reaching 250ms / frame. Normal thereafter **Target Platform:** **Target OS version/browser:** **Devices:** ## Code
code sample ```dart import 'dart:ui'; import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:flutter/rendering.dart'; void main() { runApp(MaterialApp(home: MyPage())); } class MyPage extends StatefulWidget { MyPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override _MyPageState createState() => _MyPageState(); } class _MyPageState extends State { @override void initState() { super.initState(); } _renderDialog() { return Container( alignment: Alignment.center, height: 600, child: Material( color: Colors.transparent, child: Ink( width: 100, height: 50, decoration: const BoxDecoration( gradient: LinearGradient( begin: Alignment.topLeft, end: Alignment.bottomRight, stops: [0.0, 1.0], colors: [Color(0xffccd3d92), Color(0xffce05d4b)], ), ), child: InkWell( onTap: () {}, child: Container( alignment: Alignment.center, child: const Text( 'gradient', style: TextStyle( fontSize: 14, ), ), ), ), ))); } @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( showPerformanceOverlay: true, home: Scaffold( body: Center( child: TextButton( child: Text('show'), onPressed: () { showModalBottomSheet( context: context, isScrollControlled: true, builder: (ctx) { return _renderDialog(); }); }, ), )), ); } } ```

title: Document on flutter's wiki the versioning schema for releases

labels.name: d: wiki
labels.description: Flutter or engine wikis

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Flutter is working on following the OSSF best practices and some of those best practices are related to documentation of releases. Even though the information exists it is already spread on multiple places and not easy to find by someone new to the flutter community.

title: [Web][Integration Test] Two Chrome instances launched, and the unnecessary Chrome instance breaks the foundation of the integration test [Edited]

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

labels.name: platform-web
labels.description: Web applications specifically

labels.name: integration_test
labels.description: The flutter/packages/integration_test plugin

labels.name: has reproducible steps
labels.description: The issue is ready to work on.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

labels.name: found in release: 2.10
labels.description: Found to occur in 2.10

labels.name: found in release: 2.13
labels.description: Found to occur in 2.13

body: With example in https://docs.flutter.dev/cookbook/testing/integration/introduction, after executing the command: ``` flutter drive \ --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart \ --target=integration_test/app_test.dart \ -d chrome ``` One Chrome is opened. Be noticed that it is not labelled with 'chrome is controlled by automated test software'. Then try to execute the command plus arg `--no-headless`: ``` flutter drive \ --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart \ --target=integration_test/app_test.dart \ -d chrome \ --no-headless ``` Two Chrome instances are launched: - One [backend one] is launched as device [this is NOT intend for test cases execution] - The other [frontend one] is launched via webdriver (chromedriver this case) [this is intend for test cases execution, labelled with 'chrome is controlled by automated test software'] [**Note**: Mostly, the two Chromes are overlaid, please try to drag it away (up or down), then back one would be visible.] Both Chrome instances have test executed. However, the Chrome is launched not via chromedriver has major negative impact to test: - For js, css loading, increase the networking pressure as need to load two copies - For some write, delete scenarios, the test will result in unexpected results (as two Chromes both will try to execute delete action) **That is, the unnecessary Chrome instance breaks the foundation of the integration test (via flutter drive)** ---- Source Code Analysis: Flow the flutter drive flow ---- - (1) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/drive.dart#L243-L244 https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/drive.dart#L252-L259 https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/drive.dart#L274-L275 - (2) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/drive/web_driver_service.dart#L93 - (3) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/isolated/resident_web_runner.dart#L307-L314 - (4) https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/web/web_device.dart#L120-L153 Per above code, it shows: - Per (1) the --no-launch-chrome is set to true if web, but per (3)(4) it is not passed to startApp, that is, below expression is always true https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/web/web_device.dart#L143 - However, even the --no-launch-chrome is passed correctly, the code will exit with error, as there exists isAppStarted check https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/6af40a7004f886c8b8b87475a40107611bc5bb0a/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/drive/web_driver_service.dart#L117-L119

title: PathProvider in ios simulator isolate does not work even registerWith()

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
When run PathProvider's any method on isolate, Exception(MissingPluginException) occur. 
Even I ran `PathProviderIOS.registerWith();`!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26822105/159149642-91265cc4-17a5-4a02-a1b4-08625f999ff9.png)

Considering that it does not occur when the method of Pathprovider is called at the UI level, it is not a problem with the Simulator. It always happens only in Isolates I create.

I already run `flutter clean` `flutter pub get` 'reinstall flutter sdk', 'reinstall app on simulator' 

Any solutions?

part of my code
``` 
static Future<void> initialize() async {
    PathProviderIOS.registerWith();
    final String path = (await getApplicationDocumentsDirectory()).path + '/db';
    try {
      store = await openStore();
    } catch (e) {
      store = Store.attach(getObjectBoxModel(), path);
    }
```

title: TextField not getting onSubmitted callback - Flutter Web

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
TextField not getting submitted on Android Chrome.  Works just fine on Desktop chrome (though no OS keyboard) and Android native.

### Setup
Add a single TextField with an `onSubmit`:

```
 TextField(
              controller: controller,
              autocorrect: false,
              enableSuggestions: false,
              maxLength: 5,
              autofocus: false,
              textInputAction: TextInputAction.search,
              onSubmitted: (String text) {
                setState(() {
  /// do stuff with `text`!
```

### Expected
When hitting "enter" on the keyboard, the keyboard is dismissed and the input fed to `onSubmitted`.

### Actual
* Keyboard remains
* `onSubmitted` never called
* "suggestions" above input flicker

### Horrible work around
Click on the first suggestion; then click enter. This produces the desired outcome.

<summary>  flutter doctor </summary>

title: FLUTTER_FRAMEWORK_DIR didn't exist in Generated.xcconfig, which cause ios build failed.

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into. -->

1. Clone git SDK project from Flutter docs (Install Guide)
2. Use VS Code Way 

- create test-drive-project by command line 
- Install plugins Flutter And Dart
- Try run select different folders for test-drive-project.
       - Apply in pop-up window to use Flutter SDK (after). Now is working
- Run by F5
- It's Worked. OK. But refactor functions is missng. Then I went use Intellij.

3. Intellij Way

- Install plugins from Flutter docs (Flutter And Dart)
- Restart IDE
- Create Flutter New project by IDE , but set a dest project folder above the VS Code project. 
- I want Flutter for Windows Desktop (Not for Mobile)
- I use recomend command before creating project, in SDK folder like: `--enable-linux-desktop`, and for macos, and for windows done the same.
- Then create project by press FINISH.
- Select run by windows (green triangles button)
- Not working, error.
- Then I try use command from error link wolloving to docs. It new commands also not working , throw error.
- ANd I run `flutter doctor` in Terminal in Intellij, and see this error.
- The end.

### Error logs:

- Output of `flutter build ios --verbose`: [flutter_build_ios.log](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/8264189/flutter_build_ios.log) (2.5Mb)

I've tried removing ios/Flutter/Flutter.podspec, I've made sure I'm running the most up to date packages.  I've generally been having a generally bad experience with iOS + flutter for a while, maybe something in my case is wrong and fixable? These are the issues i've been living with:

- Builds take 5-10 minutes which is just a nightmare for fixing issues or diagnosing build problems like this
- I'm unable to run from VSCode - it tells me that i should try running from Xcode instead

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
We are testing our app with integrationtests. At one point we mock method channel with of a plugin. In the method channel name is the view_id. So the channel name is dynamic. To correctly mock it, we need to get this id from the widget. 

The _inboundHandlers Variable of tester.binding.defaultBinaryMessenger contains the channel name with the id, but its private.

title: iOS 15(iPhone OS 15.4 (19E241)) Flutter 2.8.1 got crash because of EXC_CORPSE_NOTIFY

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. For now, it is reproducible on one user's phone. (I havn't check if all the device on 15.4(19E241) can reproduce this crash)
2. We use InAppPurchasePlugin to handle the in-app purchase.
3. When InAppPurchasePlugin ask user to re-enter the password, and the user refused, the crash will reproduce on user's phone.

title: DraggableScrollableBottomSheet rebuilds every single frame while dragging

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

The `DraggableScrollableBottomSheet` rebuilds its child every single frame while dragging up and down. In my case that means, my `FutureBuilder` is fetching every single frame data from Firebase. 

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Drag up and down <!-- describe steps to demonstrate bug -->
3. Watch console for print <!-- for example "Tap on X and see a crash" -->

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->

Only fetch data once and do not rebuild every frame.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

Executes the fetch every single frame.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->


```
                    FutureBuilder<QuerySnapshot<Activity>>(
                              future: FirebaseFirestore.instance
                                  .collection("activities")
                                  .get(),
                              builder: (BuildContext context,
                                  AsyncSnapshot<QuerySnapshot<Activity>>
                                      snapshot) {
                                print("BUILD");

                                if (snapshot.hasData) {
                                  return SliverList(
                                        delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(
                                      (context, index) {
                                       
                                        return ListTile(
                                          title: Text(index.toString()),
                                        );
                                     }
                                      childCount: snapshot.data!.docs.length,
                                    )),
                                  );
                                } else {
                                  return SliverToBoxAdapter(
                                    child: Container(
                                        height: 160,
                                     ),
                                  );
                                }
                              });

```


</details>

title: IgnorePointer doesn't work properly when wrapped around a webview running JS (ex. google maps)

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

Open google maps in a webview on Iphone, and wrap it in ignore pointer, absorb pointer, or anything else of the like. You can also put an alert dialog above it, and when tapping the dialog, google maps will respond.

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
No response

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
google maps responds, zooms in, drops a pin etc.
<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>


```import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/webview_flutter.dart';

class InAppWebViewBug extends StatelessWidget {
  const InAppWebViewBug({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
        body: IgnorePointer(
            child: WebView(
      javascriptMode: JavascriptMode.unrestricted,
      initialUrl: 'https://www.google.com/maps/',
    )));
  }
}
```


<!--
      Consider also attaching screenshots and/or videos to better
      illustrate the issue.

      You can upload them directly on GitHub.
      Beware that video file size is limited to 10MB.
-->

     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

This only seems to happen on physical devices. So far it has occurred with the s8 and the s10. Unsure if the issue can be reproduced elsewhere, but it does not occur in ios simulator, physical ios, or android emulator.

1. Create a `TextField` widget and type something in it
2. Tap somewhere in the middle of the text you just typed, with the intention of moving the cursor to where you tapped

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
Cursor moves to the location that was tapped
**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
The text between where you tapped and the last character in the textfield gets selected (highlighted).

Because of this issue it's very difficult for a user to go back and fix typos and such.

title: showDatePicker should be able to close itself as soon as a date is selected

labels.name: severe: new feature
labels.description: Nothing broken; request for a new capability.

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

labels.name: f: material design
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter/material repository.

labels.name: f: date/time picker
labels.description: Date or time picker widgets.

labels.name: proposal
labels.description: A detailed proposal for a change to Flutter

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Use case
Quickier date selection.
Right now, the user has to tap on the date he wants, then tap on the OK button. It would be an improvement if the user could just tap the date and have the Picker close itself without having to tap OK.

## Proposal
Add a `closeOnDateSelection` boolean which would enable this behaviour.

title: [video_player] Formatting issue with uncommon aspect ratios.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Hi there, I face an issue when using the video_player plugin with videos having uncommon aspect ratios. For example, the video texture will vertically overflow its container when the video has a fairly small aspect ratio: The red block on the right is a container having the aspect ration given by the `VideoPlayerController`, while the actual video on the left is displayed incorrectly. It can be reproduced on the latest version using the example project in [this fork](https://github.com/TomVeniat/plugins).
Video to reproduce https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5921144/157257830-342e66cd-05e2-4e11-8ee8-50bbaf919007.mp4

title: Divide main.dart.js into main.dart.mini.js + project.js

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body: Flutter web first loading is too slow for the big size of main.dart.js. Why not divide main.dart.js into main.dart.mini.js + project.js. Main.dart.mini.js only contains the flutter framework basic code, NOT changed at build time. And the project.js comains the app codes. Please consider the cocos-js solution!

title: [tool_crash] FileSystemException: Cannot create link, OS Error: Access is denied., errno = 5

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Command
```
flutter test
```

## Steps to Reproduce
I tried creating a CI/CD pipeline building a Flutter application to Windows with [DroneCI](https://www.drone.io/), but it seems that even though I allowed full access to `C:\drone` permission is still denied when creating a link in `C:\drone\src\windows\flutter\ephemeral\.plugin_symlinks\path_provider_windows`.
I also used a custom image for running the jobs (can be found [here](https://hub.docker.com/r/internerd/windows-flutter)) with Flutter and Dart installed (see the `flutter doctor -v` output below).

1. Create a Drone CI host (eg., via a docker-compose file, can be provided if needed)
2. Create a Windows runner which registers to the DroneCI host (can also be provided)
3. With the following `drone.yml` the logs below are reproducable:
```yml
kind: pipeline
type: docker
name: windows-app

platform:
  platform:
  os: windows
  version: "1809"

steps:
  - name: test
    image: internerd/windows-flutter
    commands:
      - whoami
      - flutter doctor
      - flutter test
```


## Logs

I got into this problem since last month. 
- I can build APK for android-arm64, android-x86 or all of them combined.
- It can even create an android-arm apk with the command `flutter build apk --split-per-abi`
- But it cannot build apk specifically for android-arm alone.

- I tried changing gradle versions to 6.7-all, 7.3.1-bin and 7.2-bin

title: Feature: WebView support for all desktop platforms (Windows/MacOS/Linux)

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Currently, more and more customers demand for a WebView inside our desktop flutter app.
It boosts productivity, sometimes websites are quickly scanned within an application, just for a few seconds, without opening another window (and closing it)

Currently, [WebView for Flutter](https://pub.dev/packages/webview_flutter) is a very popular plugin for mobile platforms, but **this does not work for e.g. Windows**.
I know that there are other plugins such as [flutter-webview-windows](https://github.com/jnschulze/flutter-webview-windows), but it is only working for windows and we want to offer our application to Mac and Linux users aswell.

Are there any official plans to support WebView on desktop platforms?
I'm asking because the "View/report issues" of [WebView for Flutter](https://pub.dev/packages/webview_flutter) is tied to the flutter-repository.

body: Hi there! I'm having a trouble with some videos only on iOS (on simulator and real devices) when I run the app sometimes I can watch a black screen but the audio is ok. I think this error happens when the video has the property `Rotation != 0` in its metadata because all videos with this error have the same property ![Screen Shot 2022-03-02 at 16 49 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6619953/156463663-5d65c50a-7e6a-4a9f-9382-34c171218a35.png) ## Steps to Reproduce This is a sample code for reproduce it ```dart import 'package:video_player/video_player.dart'; import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() => runApp(VideoApp()); class VideoApp extends StatefulWidget { @override _VideoAppState createState() => _VideoAppState(); } class _VideoAppState extends State { late VideoPlayerController _controller; @override void initState() { super.initState(); _controller = VideoPlayerController.network( 'https://api.twilio.com/2010-04-01/Accounts/AC76fb458b55e79b1b8bd708a97ecb402b/Messages/MM340b85cb76dd1b2efb9098e7cdccde79/Media/ME907cb230497a03957c5dcee5afbefc54') ..initialize().then((_) { setState(() {}); }); } @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( title: 'Video Demo', home: Scaffold( body: Center( child: _controller.value.isInitialized ? AspectRatio( aspectRatio: _controller.value.aspectRatio, child: VideoPlayer(_controller), ) : Container(), ), floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton( onPressed: () { setState(() { _controller.value.isPlaying ? _controller.pause() : _controller.play(); }); }, child: Icon( _controller.value.isPlaying ? Icons.pause : Icons.play_arrow, ), ), ), ); } @override void dispose() { super.dispose(); _controller.dispose(); } } ``` And this is `flutter --version` ``` Flutter 2.10.2 • channel stable • https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git Framework • revision 097d3313d8 (12 days ago) • 2022-02-18 19:33:08 -0600 Engine • revision a83ed0e5e3 Tools • Dart 2.16.1 • DevTools 2.9.2 ``` This is an example video with the property `Rotation = 90` https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6619953/156464792-928fc1f6-d9fd-4bc7-a846-501f084cc8c5.mp4

title: [video_player][Android] Looping network video downloads data repeatedly

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->
I'm experiencing an issue with the video_player package on Android. I couldn't reproduce it on iOS. 

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a flutter app with the video_player package `2.2.19`.
2. Integrate the custom widget `LoopingVideo` of the code sample in the app.
3. Run the app on an Android device or emulator.
4. Navigate to the code sample widget and keep it visible on the screen.
5. Inspect the data consumption.

**Expected results:** The player downloads the video one time and loops over it. It's even possible to cut the network connection of the device once the video is fully downloaded and it repeats the video forever.

**Actual results:** The player downloads the video over and over again, probably once for every loop replay. If you cut the network connection of the device, the loop iterates a couple of times and then stops.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:video_player/video_player.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

class LoopingVideo extends StatefulWidget {
  final _LoopingVideoState _state;

  LoopingVideo({required String url}) : _state = _LoopingVideoState(url);

  @override
  _LoopingVideoState createState() => _state;
}

class _LoopingVideoState extends State<LoopingVideo> {
  VideoPlayerController? _controller;
  final String _url;

  _LoopingVideoState(this._url);

  @override
  void initState() {
    super.initState();
    final playerOptions = VideoPlayerOptions(mixWithOthers: true);

    _controller = VideoPlayerController.network(
      _url,
      videoPlayerOptions: playerOptions,
    );

    _controller?.initialize().then((_) {
      setState(() {
        _controller?.setVolume(0.0);
        _controller?.play();
        _controller?.setLooping(true);
      });
    });
  }

  @override
  void dispose() {
    _controller?.pause();
    _controller?.dispose();
    _controller = null;
    super.dispose();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    if (_controller?.value.isInitialized ?? false) {
      return AspectRatio(
        aspectRatio: _controller!.value.aspectRatio,
        child: VideoPlayer(_controller!),
      );
    } else {
      return Container();
    }
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>

labels.name: has reproducible steps
labels.description: The issue is ready to work on.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

labels.name: found in release: 2.10
labels.description: Found to occur in 2.10

labels.name: found in release: 2.11
labels.description: Found to occur in 2.11

body:
The problem is that when I use the CanvasKit renderer, text widgets that use ellipses for handling overflow show an additional character at the end which looks like a square. This doesn't happen with the default web font but in my tests, it happened with both my imported `ttf` font and Google Fonts. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a new project and use the sample code provided here. 2. Make sure you add the google-fonts package using `flutter pub add google_fonts`. 3. Run the app using the CanvasKit renderer by running `flutter run --web-renderer canvaskit`. 4. Observe the extra character at the end. Optionally you can compare it with using HTML renderer and see how that works fine. **Expected results:** **Actual results:**
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:google_fonts/google_fonts.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( home: Material( color: Colors.white, child: Center( child: SizedBox( width: 500, child: Material( color: Colors.transparent, child: Text( 'This is just a text which is long enough to trigger the ellipses overflow' ' so we can see how it is not working correctly using the CanvasKit renderer.', style: GoogleFonts.allan(fontSize: 30), overflow: TextOverflow.ellipsis, maxLines: 2, ), ), ), ), ), ); } } ```
Logs `flutter doctor -v` ``` [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.10.2, on macOS 12.2.1 21D62 darwin-x64, locale en-US) • Flutter version 2.10.2 at /Users/behnamsattar/tools/bin/flutter • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision 097d3313d8 (10 days ago), 2022-02-18 19:33:08 -0600 • Engine revision a83ed0e5e3 • Dart version 2.16.1 • DevTools version 2.9.2 [!] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3) • Android SDK at /Users/behnamsattar/Library/Android/sdk ✗ cmdline-tools component is missing Run `path/to/sdkmanager --install "cmdline-tools;latest"` See https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line for more details. ✗ Android license status unknown. Run `flutter doctor --android-licenses` to accept the SDK licenses. See https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install/macos#android-setup for more details. title: [web] [html-renderer] Path.combine() is not implemented

labels.name: r: duplicate

body:
## Steps to Reproduce Use `Path.combine()` method using the HTML renderer and see that it throws an `UnimplementedError`. Sample code with screenshots is provided below. **Expected results:** Running on CanvasKit renderer: **Actual results:** Running on HTML renderer:
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return Container( color: Colors.white, child: Center( child: CustomPaint( painter: PathPainter(), ), ), ); } } class PathPainter extends CustomPainter { @override void paint(Canvas canvas, Size size) { final paint = Paint() ..color = Colors.black ..strokeWidth = 3.0 ..style = PaintingStyle.fill; final pathOne = Path() ..addRect( Rect.fromCenter( center: Offset(0, 0), width: 300, height: 300, ), ); final pathTwo = Path() ..addRect( Rect.fromCenter( center: Offset(150, 150), width: 100, height: 100, ), ); final combinedPath = Path.combine(PathOperation.union, pathOne, pathTwo); canvas.drawPath(combinedPath, paint); } @override bool shouldRepaint(covariant CustomPainter oldDelegate) => true; } ```

labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Details
If you set ListTile -> selected to true and set selectedTileColor, this will be visible outside the list on any transparent Wiget. Same applies to the highlight/splash effect on Inkwell Items inside ListView - the aren't cut at the border of the Listview.
Tested under Win 11, Web and Desktop app.

### Actual result
The background color of the selected ListTiles/Inkwell is visible outside of my ListView. Same applies with a Inkwell highlight on hover/splash effect.

No element of the list should ever be visible outside the list.

title: BorderRadius.circular should be a const constructor

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
As of Flutter 2.11, the `BorderRadius.circular` constructor isn't `const` but I think, it could be. Other constructors are.

This would allow something like this:

```
const FluentContextMenu({Key? key, required this.items, this.borderRadius = const BorderRadius.circular(8)}) : super(key: key);
```

As a workaround, I have to do this:

```
const FluentContextMenu({Key? key, required this.items, this.borderRadius = const BorderRadius.all(Radius.circular(8))}) : super(key: key);
```

title: SEO Support

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal

<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

I just want to know what the progress is on SEO support in Flutter - specifically with 1. crawler support and 2. meta tag support:

1. crawlers still struggle to actually render my website past the #. I understand this is an issue with all SPA/JS based apps however considering Flutter 2.0 Navigation (and the fact that this is a Google Framework) I feel we should have some better support for this? Maybe we could support native prerendering on build (like NextJS) or similar to help make the sites more crawlable.

2. meta tags need a way to be updated dynamically to support keywords and all that fun stuff

While there are a handful of plugins that help with this - like [SEO renderer](https://pub.dev/packages/seo_renderer) - I do think native support for this would be a great way to increase the popularity of the platform, especially when compared to other SPA frameworks.

Mostly just interested in if this (SEO in general) is even on the timeline for Flutter. Is this of interest at all or just not an issue the Flutter team views as a Flutter problem.

Thank you in advance!

title: Can't scroll a NestedScrollView with a not expandable pinned SliverAppBar

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Summary

If we don't set the `expandedHeight` of a `SliverAppBar` or if we set it to the same value than the `collapsedHeight`, then we can't scroll a list under a `NestedScrollView`.

If for example we change the `SliverAppBar` declaration (in the following code sample) by this instead, we can scroll: 
```dart
SliverAppBar(
  title: const Text('Books'),
  pinned: true,
  expandedHeight: kToolbarHeight + 0.005,
  forceElevated: innerBoxIsScrolled,
),
```

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Try to scroll

**Expected results:**
We should be able to scroll the list.

**Actual results:**
We can't scroll.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  static const String _title = 'Flutter Code Sample';

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      title: _title,
      home: MyStatelessWidget(),
    );
  }
}

class MyStatelessWidget extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyStatelessWidget({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    final List<String> _tabs = <String>['Tab 1', 'Tab 2'];
    return DefaultTabController(
      length: _tabs.length,
      child: Scaffold(
        body: NestedScrollView(
          headerSliverBuilder: (BuildContext context, bool innerBoxIsScrolled) {
            return <Widget>[
              SliverOverlapAbsorber(
                handle:
                    NestedScrollView.sliverOverlapAbsorberHandleFor(context),
                sliver: SliverAppBar(
                  title: const Text('Books'),
                  pinned: true,
                  expandedHeight: kToolbarHeight,
                  forceElevated: innerBoxIsScrolled,
                ),
              ),
            ];
          },
          body: SafeArea(
            top: false,
            bottom: false,
            child: Builder(
              builder: (BuildContext context) {
                return CustomScrollView(
                  slivers: <Widget>[
                    SliverOverlapInjector(
                      handle: NestedScrollView.sliverOverlapAbsorberHandleFor(
                          context),
                    ),
                    SliverPadding(
                      padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
                      sliver: SliverFixedExtentList(
                        itemExtent: 48.0,
                        delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(
                          (BuildContext context, int index) {
                            return ListTile(
                              title: Text('Item $index'),
                            );
                          },
                          childCount: 30,
                        ),
                      ),
                    ),
                  ],
                );
              },
            ),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

When I log in using google_sign_in in Flutter App, an error occurs:

title: Apple Watch target detection does not work for new Apple Watch targets

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: tool
labels.description: Affects the "flutter" command-line tool. See also t: labels.

labels.name: t: xcode
labels.description: "xcodebuild" on iOS and general Xcode project management

labels.name: has reproducible steps
labels.description: The issue is ready to work on.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

labels.description: Found to occur in 2.10

<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## NOTE
This IS NOT an issue regarding Flutter supporting Apple Watch targets in general. I created #97721 already, but that one was closed as a duplicate. This is NOT a duplicate issue (unless someone beat me to it). Apple Watch targets created by older versions of Xcode used to build fine with Flutter.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an iOS flutter project using `flutter create`
2. Add an Apple Watch target
3. Fix miscellaneous unrelated issues with the generated watch target (thanks Xcode)
4. Run `flutter build ios`

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->

Flutter detects that the project contains an Apple Watch target and adjusts the build settings accordingly. The following line should appear in the build log:

```console
Watch companion app found.
```

Successful build

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

Flutter cannot detect that new Apple Watch targets created by Xcode exist because the structure of Apple Watch targets changed

      🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter
    • Dart plugin can be installed from:

      macOS 12.2.1 21D62 darwin-arm
    • Chrome (web)            • chrome                    • web-javascript •
      Google Chrome 98.0.4758.109
    ! Error: Aaron’s iPhone is busy: Preparing the watch for development via
      Aaron’s iPhone. Xcode will continue when Aaron’s iPhone is finished. (code
      -10)

[✓] HTTP Host Availability
    • All required HTTP hosts are available

! Doctor found issues in 1 category.
```

</details>


## Additional Information
Currently, Flutter looks for a `WKCompanionAppBundleIdentifier` key in plist files, but that key no longer exists in new Apple Watch targets.

The watchkitapp target no longer contains a plist by default, and the watchkitextension target contains a plist with the following contents:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
	<key>NSExtension</key>
	<dict>
		<key>NSExtensionAttributes</key>
		<dict>
			<key>WKAppBundleIdentifier</key>
			<string>dev.rexios.appleWatchTest.watchkitapp</string>
		</dict>
		<key>NSExtensionPointIdentifier</key>
		<string>com.apple.watchkit</string>
	</dict>
</dict>
</plist>
```

This issue can be worked around by adding the following items to the watchkitextension plist:
```xml
<key>WKCompanionAppBundleIdentifier</key>
<string>dev.rexios.appleWatchTest</string>
```

Ideally this workaround would be unnecessary.

Location of the issue in the Flutter repo: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/e4351ff0531fe7be2c7b62e41683d60ffba421b4/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/xcode_project.dart#L335

title: Autofill on web does not work. Same code works fine on Android.

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce
Autofill does not work on a web application we are developing. To eliminate the problem, I created simple app with few fields and an autofill by following directions on AutofillGroup-class.html

How to reproduce:
Ran code sample from https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/widgets/AutofillGroup-class.html as web application in chrome. 

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run -d chrome --verbose` on the code sample published at https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/widgets/AutofillGroup-class.html 
2. autofill does not work.

**Expected results:** autofill on an attempt to populate fields

**Actual results:** autofill does not work

      ),

}

}

        AutofillGroup(

title: [Android] Copy paste is not working when copying text from some other application

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1, Create new Flutter Project
2. Copy text from Samsung Notes
3. Try paste it to text field in Flutter app

**Expected results:**
It should paste text to the text field.
It works in one of my older Flutter apps that built in 2020 and it also worked before in my other Flutter app, .
This also works in other apps that do not use Flutter.

**Actual results:**
Now it shows Paste button but it doesn't do anything.
Tested this also in new example app and also other computer where I have other Flutter app.

No issues found from flutter doctor.

Tested in Samsung Galaxy S8 (Android 9) and Galaxy S9.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Execute `flutter run --profile`  or `flutter run --release` on the code sample
2. Open the drawer
3. Rotate the device

**Expected results:** 
The app should rebuild in landscape, as seen in debug mode.

**Actual results:**
The app crashes.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const TestApp());
}

class TestApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const TestApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: Scaffold(
        drawer: const Drawer(),
        appBar: AppBar(),
        body: const Center(
          child: Text('Rotate device after opening drawer'),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

title: ListView jank when app resumed from background

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
This is something I noticed a while back and applies to any screen on any app, so it isn't specific to the version of flutter that was just released today.

I've provided a code sample below, but any screen with a ListView will work.  

1.) Install a release version of the app on **iOS (not sure about Android)**
2.) Run app, and then send the app to the background
3.) Click the app icon to bring the app back up from the background and immediately swipe up or down.
4.) You will see jank on the scroll.

Additional notes:
1.) After resuming the app, if you pause for half a second before swiping then you will not see jank.
2.) You will continue to get jank until you stop scrolling for half a second.  Meaning if you click the app icon to resume the already running app, and you swipe immediately, and keep swiping then you will keep getting jank for many seconds.
3.) This is the weirdest one: If you are doing a screen record IT DOES NOT JANK.  I figured this out when trying to create a screen recording of the issue.  
3.b.) I'm not sure what starting a screen recording does that resolves this issue, but Native iOS apps don't have this issue either way.
4.) It may seem like a minor issue, but in practice, users regularly start scrolling as soon as they resume apps with lists of data, which hurts the perceived quality of the app.  

Here is a minimum code sample that you can plug into a new flutter project:
```
class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: ListView.builder(
        itemCount: 200,
        itemBuilder: (BuildContext context, int index) {
          return Container(
            height: 100,
            color: index.isEven ? Colors.grey.shade600 : Colors.grey.shade800,
            child: Row(
              mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
              children: [
                Column(
                  mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
                  children: [
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                    const SizedBox(height: 32),
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                  ],
                ),
                const SizedBox(
                  width: 32,
                ),
                Column(
                  mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
                  children: [
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                    const SizedBox(height: 32),
                    Text(
                      index.toString() + ' line of text',
                      style: const TextStyle(color: Colors.white),
                    ),
                  ],
                )
              ],
            ),
          );
        },
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

title: SystemChrome.getPreferredOrientations

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
We already have the very useful SystemChrome.setPreferredOrientations() method, which probably all of us use. 

Recently I came across the issue of having one screen in an app that get's called from a lot of different pages and is the only one that can go landscape.

When disposing, I set the preferredOrientations back to just portraitUp, but I wanted to have a solution that is a little more flexible and just remembers the preferredOrientations before we changed it, so that I can just return it to the previous 'version' when disposing, rather than having it hardcoded.

I tried to write some native code to get the preferredOrientations, but I was unable to find out where they were stored on iOS and Android. 

Would a SystemChrome.getPreferredOrientations() method make sense/be possible/useful?

title: [docs] Contradicting migration docs

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
When following docs to [migrate from Android Embedding V1 to V2](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Upgrading-pre-1.12-Android-projects#full-flutter-app-migration), in step 4, after setting both `LaunchTheme` and `NormalTheme` styles, next thing to do is *"Configure `MainActivity` to start with launch theme (...)"*. One of the specified things you have to do is make sure you have a `<meta-data android:name="io.flutter.embedding.android.SplashScreenDrawable">`.

However, after setting this, when you build your app you get a deprecation warning:

    W/FlutterActivityAndFragmentDelegate(14336): A splash screen was provided to Flutter, but this is deprecated. See flutter.dev/go/android-splash-migration for migration steps.

When visiting [mentioned URL](https://flutter.dev/go/android-splash-migration), you can see that `io.flutter.embedding.android.SplashScreenDrawable` **is deprecated and should actually be removed**, which is the opposite you get told to do in previous docs.

Further than this, at least in my case, removing the aforementioned `<meta-data>` causes splash screen not to show the app logo anymore.

---

**TL;DR** Two docs telling to do contradicting stuff.
