title: Can't type into TextField focused via FocusNode.requestFocus(), in web browser

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup the Flutter Code Lab 3 (Friendly Chat), [Part 7](https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/flutter#6). The full source is here: https://github.com/flutter/codelabs/blob/1cf1863b08c9f28cc3c2cc8155506471ffae035d/friendly_chat/step_07/lib/main.dart
2. Run the app in debug mode in Chrome:
```
flutter run -d chrome
```
3. Click on the "Send a message" text field, type something in, and hit Enter. In the code, this results in the text field being cleared and then refocused using `FocusNode.requestFocus()`.
4. Note that the "Send a message" text field has been cleared, but is still focused (there's a blinking cursor inside). Try typing again: nothing happens / no text appears in the focused text field!

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->

I expected that what I typed would appear in the text field, like the first time it was focused.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

Nothing happens / no text appears in the focused text field! 

I also tested in Firefox and got the same result.

On the other hand, when I test in an android emulator, it works as expected.

If I (redundently) refocus the (already focused) text field by clicking on it again or pressing Tab a few times, then typing into it works again. In Firefox I was able to determine that the field is not really focused, as far as input focus is concerned from Firefox's point of view, since I'm using an extension there that provides shortcuts without modifer keys (e.g. typing plain "b" is a shortcut) and these shortcuts get triggered when the field is in the "focused but not receiving input" state. I also tried in vanilla Firefox with no extensions, and the problem persists.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
// Copyright 2017, 2020 The Flutter team. All rights reserved.
// Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license
// that can be found in the LICENSE file.

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(
    const FriendlyChatApp(),
  );
}

String _name = 'Your Name';

class FriendlyChatApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const FriendlyChatApp({
    Key? key,
  }) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      title: 'FriendlyChat',
      home: ChatScreen(),
    );
  }
}

class ChatMessage extends StatelessWidget {
  const ChatMessage({
    required this.text,
    Key? key,
  }) : super(key: key);
  final String text;

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Container(
      margin: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(vertical: 10.0),
      child: Row(
        crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.start,
        children: [
          Container(
            margin: const EdgeInsets.only(right: 16.0),
            child: CircleAvatar(child: Text(_name[0])),
          ),
          Column(
            crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.start,
            children: [
              Text(_name, style: Theme.of(context).textTheme.headline4),
              Container(
                margin: const EdgeInsets.only(top: 5.0),
                child: Text(text),
              ),
            ],
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }
}

class ChatScreen extends StatefulWidget {
  const ChatScreen({
    Key? key,
  }) : super(key: key);

  @override
  State<ChatScreen> createState() => _ChatScreenState();
}

class _ChatScreenState extends State<ChatScreen> {
  final List<ChatMessage> _messages = [];
  final _textController = TextEditingController();
  final FocusNode _focusNode = FocusNode();

  void _handleSubmitted(String text) {
    _textController.clear();
    var message = ChatMessage(
      text: text,
    );
    setState(() {
      _messages.insert(0, message);
    });
    _focusNode.requestFocus();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(title: const Text('FriendlyChat')),
      body: Column(
        children: [
          Flexible(
            child: ListView.builder(
              padding: const EdgeInsets.all(8.0),
              reverse: true,
              itemBuilder: (_, index) => _messages[index],
              itemCount: _messages.length,
            ),
          ),
          const Divider(height: 1.0),
          Container(
            decoration: BoxDecoration(color: Theme.of(context).cardColor),
            child: _buildTextComposer(),
          ),
        ],
      ),
    );
  }

  Widget _buildTextComposer() {
    return IconTheme(
      data: IconThemeData(color: Theme.of(context).colorScheme.secondary),
      child: Container(
        margin: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 8.0),
        child: Row(
          children: [
            Flexible(
              child: TextField(
                controller: _textController,
                onSubmitted: _handleSubmitted,
                decoration:
                    const InputDecoration.collapsed(hintText: 'Send a message'),
                focusNode: _focusNode,
              ),
            ),
            Container(
              margin: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 4.0),
              child: IconButton(
                  icon: const Icon(Icons.send),
                  onPressed: () => _handleSubmitted(_textController.text)),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. Draw a CircularProgressIndicator inside a rect

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22373191/154630323-0a6fc98a-a61f-4a60-9425-5cb0dbc0d81d.png)

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Outerbound of the Circle to be inside the rect

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

https://dartpad.dev/ff216dcfc7e84112b7e3267a2807d298

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
class MyWidget extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Container(
      height: 100,
      width: 100,
      color: Colors.yellow,
      child: CircularProgressIndicator(
        color: Colors.red,
        value: 1,
      ),
    );
  }
}
```
This also creates further complications when trying to draw customshaders since the rect doesnt completely cover the progressIndicator

-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->
### I've already upload this simple project to my github repo
[Link to my repo](https://github.com/phungchiminhquang/Flutter_mapScreen)
1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample
2. Press on "right arrow" button you will see a black square at the mark location

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
I want to see a marker like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58564617/154276184-c8bfd3b4-da6a-425b-80fe-7a8d7c8686c9.png)

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58564617/154276811-b69666c3-4286-4ac3-a96e-31eb6f816573.png)

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:google_maps_flutter/google_maps_flutter.dart';

class MapScreen extends StatefulWidget {
  const MapScreen({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  _MapScreenState createState() => _MapScreenState();
}

class _MapScreenState extends State<MapScreen> {
  Set<Marker> _marker = {};
  GoogleMapController? controller;
  BitmapDescriptor? _markerIcon;
  void onMapCreated() {
    setState(() {
      _marker.add(Marker(
          markerId: MarkerId("test"),
          position: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
          icon: _markerIcon!));
    });
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    _createMarkerImageFromAsset(context);
    return Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(
          title: Text("Map Screen"),
        ),
        body: GoogleMap(
            onMapCreated: _onMapCreated,
            markers: <Marker>{_createMarker()},
            initialCameraPosition: CameraPosition(
                target: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
                zoom: 15)));
  }

  Marker _createMarker() {
    if (_markerIcon != null) {
      return Marker(
        markerId: MarkerId("marker_1"),
        position: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
        icon: _markerIcon!,
      );
    } else {
      return Marker(
        markerId: MarkerId("marker_1"),
        position: LatLng(10.877611249724893, 106.80955616597318),
      );
    }
  }

  Future<void> _createMarkerImageFromAsset(BuildContext context) async {
    if (_markerIcon == null) {
      final ImageConfiguration imageConfiguration =
          createLocalImageConfiguration(context, size: Size.square(10));
      BitmapDescriptor.fromAssetImage(
              imageConfiguration, 'assets/b.png')
          .then(_updateBitmap);
    }
  }

  void _updateBitmap(BitmapDescriptor bitmap) {
    setState(() {
      _markerIcon = bitmap;
    });
  }

  void _onMapCreated(GoogleMapController controllerParam) {
    setState(() {
      controller = controllerParam;
    });
  }
}
```


<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

title: Flutter webview allow unique WKProcessPool

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case
Android webview already share same localstorage. But not the ios webview.
We would shared local storage between multiple webview.
(We would keep the possibility to execute scripts to a specific webview).
<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal
Use the WKProcessPool
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36332208/two-wkwebviews-share-local-storage-but-only-after-restart
<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

2. Enable VoiceControl (Settings -> Accessibility -> Voice Control) 
3. Run app
4. Say `Scroll down` or `Scroll Up`
5. Observe app's behavior

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
ListView scrolls when command recognized 

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Bubble with recognized command appears, however, app doesn't react

<details>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: ListView.builder(
        itemBuilder: (context, index) => ListTile(title: Text('Tile $index')),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

title: Color spaces in flutter

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case
I released a photo sharing app, and some professional photographers have asked about offering a wider color space than sRGB. I wasn't able to find documentation anywhere about whether flutter supports wider color spaces when displaying images, and if so, how to use those color spaces.

I'm assuming that simply displaying images through an `ImageProvider` uses the sRGB color space, though I could be wrong on this - if so please clarify. 

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal
Provide some way to display images through a different color space such as Adobe RGB or ProPhoto RGB. If this doesn't yet exist in flutter, this is probably quite a large amount of work to implement correctly based on my limited knowledge of color spaces. 

<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

body:
The background message arrives when `obfuscate` flag is not used. Seems like this is some kind of issue related to background isolate when obfuscating code.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Clone the project from `https://github.com/sarbagyastha/obfuscate`
2. Generate an APK with `flutter build apk --release --verbose --obfuscate --split-debug-info=test/symbols` 
3. Put the app in background.
3. Grab the push token from console and send push notification with following payload:
```json
{
    "data": {
        "title": "Test Title",
        "body": "Test Body",
        "type": "promotion"
    },
    "mutable_content": true,
    "content_available": true,
    "priority": "high",
    "registration_ids": [
        "<push-token>"
    ]
}
```

**Expected results:** 
We should see a `Push Message` payload in console for the background message.

**Actual results:**
We see nothing but, these logs.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9782008/154009387-ba1ebc9c-9b09-4d2f-a9d3-695a9aa2bfbb.png)

title: [in_app_purchase] is there any way to check if someone refunded a non-consumable item?

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Currently having an issue:
- User buys a non-consumable item
- I mark it as bought in my system (in this case, removing ads)
- User refunds it
- It is still marked as bought and there is no obvious way to check a purchase history or refund status

Due to how purchase info is sent via [purchaseStream](https://pub.dev/documentation/in_app_purchase/latest/in_app_purchase/InAppPurchase/purchaseStream.html) there is no obvious way to check what purchases a user has made and possibly refunded. `restorePurchases` causes nothing to be piped into the stream. [purchaseStatus](https://pub.dev/documentation/in_app_purchase_platform_interface/latest/in_app_purchase_platform_interface/PurchaseStatus.html) does not have a value for refunded.

title: app window cannot respond after display a few minutes lottie animation on Windows 7 service pack 1.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
On windows 7 Service pack 1, after displaying the gif/lottie animation for a few minutes, the app window becomes a black screen and cannot respond. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample 2. run with release on window 7. 3. Wait a few minutes (about 3 minutes in my virtual machine) **Expected results:** Animation works fine. **Actual results:** Animation stopped, and move the mouse pointer up and the window will turn black.
Code sample need add `lottie: ^1.2.1` to pubspec deps. ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:lottie/lottie.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key); // This widget is the root of your application. @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( title: 'Flutter Demo', home: Scaffold( body: Wrap( children: [ Lottie.network( 'https://mixin-assets.zeromesh.net/stickers/5eedde22-0434-46d5-87ff-65d8ba612c67/covers/5eedde22-0434-46d5-87ff-65d8ba612c67.json', width: 100, height: 100, ), Lottie.network( 'https://mixin-assets.zeromesh.net/stickers/6a51ed77-27b8-4550-87aa-35fec3838641/covers/6a51ed77-27b8-4550-87aa-35fec3838641.json', width: 100, height: 100, ), ], ), ), ); } } ```
Logs ``` ``` ``` ``` ``` Flutter 2.11.0-0.0.pre.541 • channel master • https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git Framework • revision ad612b59e5 (3 hours ago) • 2022-02-13 17:20:18 -0800 Engine • revision cef6370095 Tools • Dart 2.17.0 (build 2.17.0-104.0.dev) • DevTools 2.10.0 ```

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer

     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Add `Icon(Icons.handshake)` or `Icon(Icons.handshake_rounded)` to any project.
2. `flutter run`

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
The [handshake icon](https://fonts.google.com/icons?selected=Material%20Icons%3Ahandshake%3A) should be shown.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Unrelated Emojis (like that [bathtub guy](https://emojipedia.org/raised-back-of-hand/)) are shown instead.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const Scaffold(
        body: Icon(Icons.handshake),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```
</details>

Clearing the pub cache or browser cache doesn't help here.

## Use case

<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

When running flutter create, Android use the following version of gradle : 
```
com.android.tools.build:gradle:4.1.0'
```

Why Flutter didn't use a more recent version ?

## Proposal

Use a recent version.
https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/gradle-plugin
<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like the `google_mobile_ads` plugin to be able to do.

     Consider attaching images showing what you are imagining.

     Does this have to be provided by the plugin directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

## Limitation

Is their any reasons to keep this old version ? Can we gain some performance and reduce production issue/crash with this ?

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2. have a page with some native ads on it (google_mobile_ads: ^1.0.1)
3. push webpage which use webview_flutter 3.0.0 to load url, then pop webpage
4. then app crash

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
it works well

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
carsh

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
WebPageProvider.pushByNamed(context, visitUrl: 'https://zh.wiktionary.org/wiki/${Uri.encodeComponent('获得')}')
```

```dart
import 'dart:async';
import 'dart:io';

import 'package:android_intent/android_intent.dart';
import 'package:flutter/foundation.dart';
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:provider/provider.dart';
import 'package:router_annotation/router_annotation.dart' as rca;
import 'package:url_launcher/url_launcher.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/platform_interface.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/webview_flutter.dart';
import 'package:words/component/material_generator.dart';
import 'package:words/component/status_view.dart';
import 'package:words/flavor/sketch.dart';
import 'package:words/pages/web/web_model.dart';

part 'web_page.g.dart';

@rca.Page(
  name: '网页',
  routeName: '/web',
)
class WebPage extends StatefulWidget {
  const WebPage({
    Key? key,
    this.stickyTitle,
    required this.visitUrl,
    this.injectJS,
  }) : super(key: key);

  final String? stickyTitle;
  final String visitUrl;
  final String? injectJS;

  @override
  State<StatefulWidget> createState() {
    return _WebPageState();
  }
}

class _WebPageState extends State<WebPage> {
  Route<dynamic>? _route;
  WebViewController? _controller;

  @override
  void initState() {
    super.initState();
    // if (Platform.isAndroid) {
    //   WebView.platform = SurfaceAndroidWebView();
    // }
  }

  @override
  void didChangeDependencies() {
    super.didChangeDependencies();
    _route ??= ModalRoute.of(context);
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return ChangeNotifierProvider<WebModel>(
      create: (BuildContext context) => WebModel(),
      child: Scaffold(
        appBar: AppBar(
          leading: IconTheme(
            data: IconTheme.of(context).copyWith(color: Sketch.primaryTextColor),
            child: createImplyLeading(),
          ),
          title: Selector<WebModel, String?>(
            selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => widget.stickyTitle ?? model.title,
            builder: (BuildContext context, String? title, Widget? child) {
              return Text(title ?? '', style: TextStyle(color: Sketch.primaryTextColor), overflow: TextOverflow.ellipsis, maxLines: 1);
            },
          ),
          backgroundColor: Colors.white,
        ),
        body: Stack(
          fit: StackFit.expand,
          children: <Widget>[
            Builder(
              builder: (BuildContext context) {
                return WebView(
                  onWebViewCreated: (WebViewController controller) {
                    _controller = controller;
                    _loadInitialUrl();
                  },
                  // initialUrl: widget.visitUrl,
                  javascriptMode: JavascriptMode.unrestricted,
                  javascriptChannels: <JavascriptChannel>{
                    JavascriptChannel(
                      name: 'DevTools',
                      onMessageReceived: (JavascriptMessage message) {
                        if (kDebugMode) {
                          print(message.message);
                        }
                      },
                    ),
                  },
                  navigationDelegate: _navigationDelegate,
                  onPageStarted: (String url) {
                    if (kDebugMode) {
                      print('onPageStarted: $url');
                    }
                    WebModel.of(context).apply(
                      title: '',
                      isLoading: true,
                      isError: false,
                    );
                  },
                  onPageFinished: (String url) {
                    if (kDebugMode) {
                      print('onPageFinished: $url');
                    }
                    if (widget.injectJS?.isNotEmpty ?? false) {
                      _controller?.runJavascript(widget.injectJS!);
                    }
                    final WebModel model = WebModel.of(context);
                    if (!model.isError) {
                      _handleTitleManyTimes(model);
                    }
                    _checkNavigationControls(model);
                    model.apply(
                      isLoading: false,
                    );
                  },
                  onWebResourceError: (WebResourceError error) async {
                    final WebModel model = WebModel.of(context);
                    if (kDebugMode) {
                      print('onWebResourceError: ${error.errorCode} - ${error.description} - ${error.domain} - ${error.errorType} - ${error.failingUrl} - ${await _controller?.currentUrl()}');
                    }
                    unawaited(_checkNavigationControls(model));
                    // if (error.errorType == WebResourceErrorType.unsupportedScheme) {
                    //   return;
                    // }
                    if (error.failingUrl == await _controller?.currentUrl()) {
                      model.apply(
                        title: '',
                        isLoading: Platform.isIOS ? false : null,
                        isError: true,
                      );
                    }
                  },
                  gestureNavigationEnabled: Platform.isIOS,
                );
              },
            ),
            Selector<WebModel, bool>(
              selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => model.isError,
              builder: (BuildContext context, bool isError, Widget? child) {
                return isError
                    ? Material(
                        color: Colors.white,
                        child: StatusError(
                          onRetry: () {
                            _reload(WebModel.of(context));
                          },
                        ),
                      )
                    : SizedBox();
              },
            ),
            Selector<WebModel, bool>(
              selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => model.isLoading,
              builder: (BuildContext context, bool isLoading, Widget? child) {
                return isLoading
                    ? Material(
                        color: Colors.white,
                        child: StatusLoading(),
                      )
                    : SizedBox();
              },
            ),
          ],
        ),
        bottomNavigationBar: _buildNavigationControls(),
        backgroundColor: Colors.white,
      ),
    );
  }

  Widget _buildNavigationControls() {
    return createBottomAppBar(
      color: Colors.white,
      child: SizedBox(
        height: Sketch.kBottomBarHeight,
        child: Row(
          children: <Widget>[
            Expanded(
              child: Selector<WebModel, bool>(
                selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => !model.isLoading && model.canGoBack,
                builder: (BuildContext context, bool canGoBack, Widget? child) {
                  return TextButton(
                    onPressed: canGoBack
                        ? () {
                            _goBack(WebModel.of(context));
                          }
                        : null,
                    style: TextButton.styleFrom(
                      minimumSize: Size.fromHeight(Sketch.kBottomBarHeight),
                    ),
                    child: Icon(Icons.arrow_back_ios, color: canGoBack ? Sketch.primaryTextColor : Sketch.tertiaryTextColor),
                  );
                },
              ),
            ),
            Expanded(
              child: Selector<WebModel, bool>(
                selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => !model.isLoading && model.canGoForward,
                builder: (BuildContext context, bool canGoForward, Widget? child) {
                  return TextButton(
                    onPressed: canGoForward
                        ? () {
                            _goForward(WebModel.of(context));
                          }
                        : null,
                    style: TextButton.styleFrom(
                      minimumSize: Size.fromHeight(Sketch.kBottomBarHeight),
                    ),
                    child: Icon(Icons.arrow_forward_ios, color: canGoForward ? Sketch.primaryTextColor : Sketch.tertiaryTextColor),
                  );
                },
              ),
            ),
            Expanded(
              child: Selector<WebModel, bool>(
                selector: (BuildContext context, WebModel model) => model.isLoading,
                builder: (BuildContext context, bool isLoading, Widget? child) {
                  return TextButton(
                    onPressed: !isLoading
                        ? () {
                            _reload(WebModel.of(context));
                          }
                        : null,
                    style: TextButton.styleFrom(
                      minimumSize: Size.fromHeight(Sketch.kBottomBarHeight),
                    ),
                    child: Icon(Icons.replay, color: !isLoading ? Sketch.primaryTextColor : Sketch.tertiaryTextColor),
                  );
                },
              ),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }

  Future<void>? _loadInitialUrl() {
    return _controller?.loadUrl(widget.visitUrl);
  }

  NavigationDecision _navigationDelegate(NavigationRequest request) {
    if (request.url.startsWith('tel:')) {
      _handleLaunchDial(request);
      return NavigationDecision.prevent;
    }
    if (request.url.startsWith('sms:')) {
      _handleLaunchSendto(request);
      return NavigationDecision.prevent;
    }
    if (!Uri.parse(request.url).isScheme('http') && !Uri.parse(request.url).isScheme('https')) {
      if (kDebugMode) {
        print('request_url: ${request.isForMainFrame} - ${request.url}');
      }
      return NavigationDecision.prevent;
    }
    return NavigationDecision.navigate;
  }

  Future<void> _handleLaunchDial(NavigationRequest request) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      final AndroidIntent intent = AndroidIntent(
        action: 'android.intent.action.DIAL',
        data: request.url,
      );
      if (await intent.canResolveActivity()) {
        await intent.launch();
      }
    } else if (Platform.isIOS) {
      if (await canLaunch(request.url)) {
        unawaited(launch(request.url));
      }
    }
  }

  Future<void> _handleLaunchSendto(NavigationRequest request) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      final AndroidIntent intent = AndroidIntent(
        action: 'android.intent.action.SENDTO',
        data: request.url,
      );
      if (await intent.canResolveActivity()) {
        await intent.launch();
      }
    } else if (Platform.isIOS) {
      if (await canLaunch(request.url)) {
        unawaited(launch(request.url));
      }
    }
  }

  Future<void> _handleTitleManyTimes(WebModel model) async {
    await _handleTitle(model);
    await Future<void>.delayed(Duration(milliseconds: 300));
    await _handleTitle(model);
  }

  Future<void> _handleTitle(WebModel model) async {
    if (_route?.isActive ?? false) {
      final String? title = await _controller?.getTitle();
      model.apply(title: title);
    }
  }

  Future<void> _checkNavigationControls(WebModel model) async {
    final bool? canGoBack = await _controller?.canGoBack();
    final bool? canGoForward = await _controller?.canGoForward();
    model.apply(
      canGoBack: canGoBack,
      canGoForward: canGoForward,
    );
  }

  Future<void> _reload(WebModel model) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      model.apply(
        title: '',
        isLoading: true,
        isError: false,
      );
    }
    final String? currentUrl = await _controller?.currentUrl();
    if (currentUrl?.isEmpty ?? true) {
      await _loadInitialUrl();
      return;
    }
    await _controller?.reload();
  }

  Future<void> _goBack(WebModel model) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      model.apply(
        title: '',
        isLoading: true,
        isError: false,
      );
    }
    await _controller?.goBack();
  }

  Future<void> _goForward(WebModel model) async {
    if (Platform.isAndroid) {
      model.apply(
        title: '',
        isLoading: true,
        isError: false,
      );
    }
    await _controller?.goForward();
  }
}

// **************************************************************************
// PageCompilerGenerator
// **************************************************************************

class WebPageController {
  String get name => WebPageProvider.name;

  String get routeName => WebPageProvider.routeName;

  WidgetBuilder get routeBuilder => WebPageProvider.routeBuilder;

  String? get flavor => WebPageProvider.flavor;

  @override
  dynamic noSuchMethod(Invocation invocation) {
    if (invocation.isGetter) {
      switch (invocation.memberName) {
        case #name:
          return name;
        case #routeName:
          return routeName;
        case #routeBuilder:
          return routeBuilder;
        case #flavor:
          return flavor;
      }
    }
    return super.noSuchMethod(invocation);
  }
}

class WebPageProvider {
  const WebPageProvider._();

  static const String? flavor = null;

  static const String name = '网页';

  static const String routeName = '/web';

  static final WidgetBuilder routeBuilder = (BuildContext context) {
    final Map<String, dynamic>? arguments =
        ModalRoute.of(context)!.settings.arguments as Map<String, dynamic>?;
    return WebPage(
      key: arguments?['key'] as Key?,
      stickyTitle: arguments?['sticky_title'] as String?,
      visitUrl: arguments?['visit_url'] as String,
      injectJS: arguments?['inject_j_s'] as String?,
    );
  };

  static Map<String, dynamic> routeArgument({
    Key? key,
    String? stickyTitle,
    required String visitUrl,
    String? injectJS,
  }) {
    return <String, dynamic>{
      'key': key,
      'sticky_title': stickyTitle,
      'visit_url': visitUrl,
      'inject_j_s': injectJS,
    };
  }

  static Future<T?> pushByNamed<T extends Object?>(
    BuildContext context, {
    Key? key,
    String? stickyTitle,
    required String visitUrl,
    String? injectJS,
  }) {
    return Navigator.of(context).pushNamed(
      routeName,
      arguments: <String, dynamic>{
        'key': key,
        'sticky_title': stickyTitle,
        'visit_url': visitUrl,
        'inject_j_s': injectJS,
      },
    );
  }
}

```dart
import 'package:flutter/widgets.dart';
import 'package:provider/provider.dart';
import 'package:words/widgets/change_notifier.dart';

class WebModel with ChangeNotifier, SafetyChangeNotifier {
  String? _title;
  bool _isLoading = true;
  bool _isError = false;
  bool _canGoBack = false;
  bool _canGoForward = false;

  String? get title => _title;

  bool get isLoading => _isLoading;

  bool get isError => _isError;

  bool get canGoBack => _canGoBack;

  bool get canGoForward => _canGoForward;

  void apply({
    String? title,
    bool? isLoading,
    bool? isError,
    bool? canGoBack,
    bool? canGoForward,
  }) {
    _title = title ?? _title;
    _isLoading = isLoading ?? _isLoading;
    _isError = isError ?? _isError;
    _canGoBack = canGoBack ?? _canGoBack;
    _canGoForward = canGoForward ?? _canGoForward;
    notifyListeners();
  }

  // ---

  static WebModel of(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider.of<WebModel>(context, listen: false);
  }
}

title: Add flutter.minSdkVersion to local.properties

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Some packages are relying on a value to be set either in local.properties or in build.gradle for the minSdk. With the newer releases of flutter this property is now  `flutter.minSdkVersion` in `build.gradle` but does not figure in local.properties.

Adding that value there would make it easier to know which value flutter is using for those packages. Also it wouldn't require the user to explicitly overwrite it so the package can know the value by reading local.properties.

title: Samsung keyboard does not show comma for number with decimals TextField

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Samsung keyboard shows disabled comma character and enabled dot character when using a `TextField` with `TextInputType.numberWithOptions(decimal: true)` keyboard type. In the Polish language, a comma is a correct decimal separator.

This issue looks like it's actually bug in Android or Samsung keyboard itself and it's not only for Polish language, those StackOverflow threads may suggest that (comments too):
* [Comma doesnt work on Samsung Android Keyboard](https://stackoverflow.com/q/65184373/3158312)
* [Decimal separator comma (',') with numberDecimal inputType in EditText](https://stackoverflow.com/q/3821539/3158312)

But just to be sure and have a record of such behavior I'm creating this issue.

<details><summary>Reproduction steps</summary>

Add `flutter_localizations` to dependencies in `pubspec.yaml`.

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter_localizations/flutter_localizations.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(
    const MaterialApp(
      locale: Locale('pl'),
      supportedLocales: [Locale('pl')],
      localizationsDelegates: GlobalMaterialLocalizations.delegates,
      home: Scaffold(
        body: Center(
          child: TextField(
            keyboardType: TextInputType.numberWithOptions(
              decimal: true,
            ),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    ),
  );
}
```

</details>

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->
This crash occurs on flutter 2.10.1 only on android (release + debug).
It does not occur on flutter 2.8.1 .


1. Execute `flutter run --debug` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
2.  press next Page button
3. press app bar back button (left arrow button)
4. Crash!

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? --> Not crash

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? --> fatal app crash

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

Minimum reproducible example
```dart


import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:google_maps_flutter/google_maps_flutter.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/webview_flutter.dart';

void main() => runApp(const MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) =>
      const MaterialApp(home: Scaffold(body: FirstPage()));
}

class FirstPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const FirstPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) => Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(title: const Text("first page (gmaps)")),
      body: Column(children: [
        const Expanded(
            child: GoogleMap(
                initialCameraPosition: CameraPosition(target: LatLng(45, 25)))),
        OutlinedButton(
            onPressed: () => Navigator.of(context)
                .push(MaterialPageRoute(builder: (_) => const SecondPage())),
            child: const Text("next Page"))
      ]));
}

class SecondPage extends StatelessWidget {
  const SecondPage({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) => Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(title: const Text("second page (webbrowser)")),
      body: const WebView(initialUrl: "http://www.google.com"));
}

title: Android Studio presence changes flutter toolchain

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Issue: Flutter uses the version of java bundled with android studio by default instead of the base system version, this is a problem because the android studio java (11) doesn't support `HmacPBESHA256 ` an algorithm used to sign builds when deploying for android. 

The only way to fix this currently is to remove android studio and develop with an alternative like `visual studio code` which is not sufficient as android studio is a much better IDE. 

## Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a flutter project and follow the steps here to signing the app https://docs.flutter.dev/deployment/android#signing-the-app
 - Note: This issue originally started when trying to develop on a windows and mac machines where it wouldnt build development or release builds of our app due to the lack of the HmacPBESHA256 algorithm on JAVA 11.  When running `flutter build apk` or `flutter build appbundle` or `flutter install` on a physical device. the app would generate a stack error of this. 
```
Execution failed for task ':app:packageRelease'.
> A failure occurred while executing com.android.build.gradle.tasks.PackageAndroidArtifact$IncrementalSplitterRunnable
   > com.android.ide.common.signing.KeytoolException: Failed to read key upload from store "C:\Users\*\StudioProjects\*\*\app\upload-keystore.jks": Integrity check failed: java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException: Algorithm HmacPBESHA256 not available
```
I followed the suggestion on stack overflow and changed the version of Java to Java 17, from the project structure page 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153084352-79d1f9a8-1636-4b4f-b9c4-1b3720bcf859.png)
and also from `gradle -version`, it says that it uses java 17
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153084590-59e2f2fc-fb36-409b-92e4-5ddf6143b9c8.png)
but i am unable to run `flutter build apk` and `flutter build appbundle` 
due to the same error 
```
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':app:packageRelease'.
> A failure occurred while executing com.android.build.gradle.tasks.PackageAndroidArtifact$IncrementalSplitterRunnable
   > com.android.ide.common.signing.KeytoolException: Failed to read key upload from store "C:\Users\**\StudioProjects\**\android\app\upload-keystore.jks": Integrity check failed: java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException: Algorithm HmacPBESHA256 not available

* Try:
> Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace.
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.

* Get more help at https://help.gradle.org

BUILD FAILED in 1m 34s
Running Gradle task 'assembleRelease'...                           95.2s
Gradle task assembleRelease failed with exit code 1
```
Flutter Doctor (note: android toolchain, uses java 11)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153085594-34ad1c6c-7832-45d3-95be-3b7c92feecd3.png)


I updated my enviroment variables for `JAVA_HOME` and `STUDIO_JDK` to my base java version and its unable to work 
```
PS C:\Users\Victor Popoola> $Env:STUDIO_JDK
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-17.0.1
PS C:\Users\Victor Popoola> $Env:JAVA_HOME
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-17.0.1
PS C:\Users\Victor Popoola>
```
so i found the solution by:  **Uninstall Android Studio**

Flutter doctor - without android studio installed, (it uses java 17 instead of 11)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22397950/153087624-553025c7-1b44-4456-b523-a9632fabb564.png)

after uninstalling android studio, I am now able to run and build my app with the system version of java. 
I am unable to build my app for android or install on host devices due to the fact that Flutter will choose the java version bundled with android studio over the one installed on the base system. i have had this issue with mac and windows machine and the current solution for this seems to be uninstalling android studio.

if you reinstall android studio, the same issue comes back and you are unable to get any work done. Unfortunately android studio is a much better ide for flutter than visual studio code. so i am providing this issue with the hopes that it gets fixed. 


<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

- create a simple flutter project
- follow the guide here to sign the app https://docs.flutter.dev/deployment/android#signing-the-app
- modify `android/app/build.gradle` to utilize the keytool 
```
signingConfigs {
        release {
            keyAlias keystoreProperties['keyAlias']
            keyPassword keystoreProperties['keyPassword']
            storeFile keystoreProperties['storeFile'] ? file(keystoreProperties['storeFile']) : null
            storePassword keystoreProperties['storePassword']
        }
    }
    buildTypes {
        release {
            minifyEnabled true
            shrinkResources true
            signingConfig signingConfigs.release
        }
    }
```
- try and build the app.
</details>

title: -ios-signing-cert

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
2 days wasted at trying to fix and find why flutter is picking up the wrong signing certificate. I have tried everything I could find on this not documented bug.

flutter config --clear-ios-signing-cert does clear anything

flutter channel master
flutter upgrade
flutter clean
flutter build ios

Doesn't do much, we get beautiful lines of terminal but after that not much.

Done my things directly in Xcode which by the way showed exactly the signing id it needed (back then). But Flutter knows better what to use to fail.

I have done multiple more trials at random things. Nothing works...

I even deleted all my certificates via 'security find-identity -p codesigning -v' and re-added only the one I wanted it still downloads a wrong one and set the project to it.

Still seaarching where is this file vim ~/.flutter_settings
To finally put:
{
  "ios-signing-cert": "Apple Development: stupidmoron@gmail.com (XXXXXXXX)",
  "enable-macos-desktop": false
}

What to do?

Bin the project, empty and cry???

And what a performance system when you build in 480sec maybe don't brag about it...

title: [google_maps_flutter] (web) The GoogleMap widget is always on top.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
The GoogleMap widget is always on top.
I have tried to use stack, dialog, and IgnorePointer to block any action of the GoogleMaps but it's not working.
I think it is a bug. I can't play this with any widget. I am using the onTab of the GoogleMap to show the GoogleMap picker, when I click dialog, dropdown menu, the container in the stack, or icon button in the area of GooleMap, the GoogleMap will action it too or I click the icon button in the same position of pin location of GoogleMap, the GoogleMap will action by show info of this location.

In my opinion. I think it is a bug. The GoogleMap should be a general widget that can be used in a variety of ways.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
You can find this issue in my video.
1. The Inkwell on a GoogleMap to show the GoogleMap picker.
At 9 seconds, I click at the pin of the location. 
After I closed the dialog, the info will show at 16 seconds. 
I already used Inkwell but GoogleMap is still active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152727927-e122bbeb-0f00-4af6-99b4-ea7d6ad2ae76.mp4

2. The IconButton with The Stack on the GoogleMap.
At 5 seconds, I click the IconButton on the blank area and the map will move to my location. 
At 15 seconds, I click the IconButton on the pin location. After this, the map will move to my location and move again to this pin location.
I already used the Stack and the IconButton is on the GoogleMap but the GoogleMap still active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152728378-ce077e9a-0ea5-4d47-a454-22e65aba69eb.mp4

3. The Dropdown Menu on GoogleMap.
At 17 seconds, I click the menu of the Dropdown on GoogleMap, and the GooleMap is active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152728702-3fd9021e-8899-43f0-88f5-aeeb0b5e832a.mp4

4. The DatePicker on GoogleMap.
At 17 seconds, I click the DatePicker on GoogleMap, and the GooleMap is active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152729043-f7122316-a626-4e9f-b2b2-90a91370aaea.mp4

5. The dialog with the context on The GoogleMap.
At 8 seconds, I click the dialog on GoogleMap, and The GooleMap is active.
At 20 seconds, you can see the info of the pin location is active too. The function of GoogleMap for show info is under the dialog but it is still active.
At 28 seconds, you can see the zoom function of The GoogleMap is active.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59549741/152729878-b7969c8c-a4a0-4cfc-a2dc-0312d3ddb3b5.mp4


-------------------------------------------------------------------------

I am using google_maps_flutter: ^2.1.1 and google_maps_flutter_web: ^0.3.2+1 package.

flutter doctor:
```
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):
[√] Flutter (Channel beta, 2.10.0-0.3.pre, on Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19042.1466], locale th-TH)
[√] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3)
[√] Chrome - develop for the web
[√] Android Studio (version 2020.3)
[√] VS Code (version 1.63.2)
[√] Connected device (2 available)
[√] HTTP Host Availability

• No issues found!
```

Now, I am using google map static API for my project.
But this solution is waste the internet to download the map picture and I need to create a custom button and function for Google Maps.
I hope the developer will solve this.

title: [integration_test] `reverFlutterImage` does not exist

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
The integration bindings tells you to call `reverFlutterImage`, but `reverFlutterImage` does not exist.

It should either be added or, if the documentation is absolute, the line telling you to call it should be removed.
See: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/ba01ec8faae9a9be3cd90ee2b7357a803b7a7178/packages/integration_test/lib/integration_test.dart#L201

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
The Material Icons for `Icons.sports_martial_arts` and `Icons.handshake` should be shown.

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Empty or wrong Icons
![flutter_01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37659158/152662963-278e3d32-75d8-40b1-9c9a-4293b7793efd.png)

          children: const [

          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

title: [Windows, Web] Hot Reload error and application connection

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Steps to Reproduce
After I updated to Flutter 2.10 I can't run hot restart or hot reload, because it always throws the error (see log).
Also, Flutter doesn't keep my application attached for a long time, after a few minutes in the code editor, I go back to the terminal and see that Flutter has lost connection with device.

I only noticed this on Windows and Web, I haven't tested it on other platforms.
I think the problem is related to my copy of Flutter.

title: SystemChrome.setEnabledSystemUIMode Broken

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. run the code sample (on my phone :) )

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
Full screen white

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
At the top, there is a black line in the size of exactly notification bar.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33402194/152657518-e4df35a9-8b53-439e-9ebb-cd1edd741b23.png)
If I pull the notification bar, the black bar disappears.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33402194/152657541-91abee16-617c-4c99-aec4-0450b3b56a0f.png)

The full screen mode works as expected in other apps on my phone.

The issue dissapears when I remove the line `SystemChrome.setEnabledSystemUIMode(SystemUiMode.immersive);`, or set it to `SystemUiMode.edgeToEdge` - both have the same effect.

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

<!--
      Please create a minimal reproducible sample that shows the problem
      and attach it below between the lines with the backticks.

      To create it you can use `flutter create bug` command and update the `main.dart` file.

      Alternatively, you can use https://dartpad.dev/
      which is capable of creating and running small Flutter apps.

      Without this we will unlikely be able to progress on the issue, and because of that
      we regretfully will have to close it.
-->

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter/services.dart';

void main() => runApp(MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatefulWidget {
  @override
  State<MyApp> createState() => _MyAppState();
}

class _MyAppState extends State<MyApp> {
  @override
  void initState(){
    SystemChrome.setEnabledSystemUIMode(SystemUiMode.immersive);
    super.initState();
  } 

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Container(color: Colors.white,);
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

<!--

title: Link moved on documentation

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
In documentation at [8. Set up basic security rules](https://firebase.google.com/codelabs/firebase-get-to-know-flutter#7)
Paragraph 3 - Instruction 1. has a link. 

In the Firebase console's Develop section, click Database, and then select the Rules tab (or [click here](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/_/database/firestore/rules) to go directly to the Rules tab).

when you follow the link, popup message appears says : "Link moved, update your bookmarks"

title: [iOS]: App crashes after upgrading from 2.8 to 2.10 throwing `Flutter SkImageFilter::filterBounds(SkIRect const&, SkMatrix const&, SkImageFilter::MapDirection, SkIRect const*) const + 164 [        ] Flutter SkImageFilter::filterBounds:`

labels.name: severe: crash
labels.description: Stack traces logged to the console.

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: engine
labels.description: flutter/engine repository. See also e: labels.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Hi,

after switching from Flutter 2.8 to 2.10 my app crashes without warning. Switching back to 2.8 and the app runs fine again. Crash happens both in debug and prod (both on a physical iPhone 11).

I'm using ShaderMasks and ColorFilters (both mode and matrix) on an image. Tried to isolate the problem, but after trying for a few hours I have no clue where in the app the problem occurs. Therefore, I cannot post any code here.

**Expected results:**
App runs with 2.10 just like it did with 2.8.

**Actual results:**
App crashes immediately.

  <summary>Logs</summary>

title: Flutter 2.10 upgrade fails at IntelliJ Plugin step on Linux

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Hi everyone, Just a heads-up about a potential problem (didn't check yet the side effects, but I'll update this ticket with any other findings) that happens when doing the Flutter upgrade from 2.8.1 to 2.10.0. I'm doing this on a Pop_OS! 21.10 distro, which is up to date (incl IntelliJ plugins) at the time of this writing. ```shell $ uname -a Linux dxps 5.15.15-76051515-generic #202201160435~1642693824~21.10~97db1bb SMP Thu Jan 20 17:35:05 U x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux $ ``` ## Steps to Reproduce Just doing `flutter upgrade` and `flutter doctor -v`. title: [google_sign_in] How do I set consent=prompt for the sign in?

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
As of right now whenever a user has given consent for the scopes that were requested the sign in view does not show the consent prompt again.
This obviously is the expected behavior in most cases.
But it seems that the returned authorization code then cannot be exchanged once again to obtain a refresh token.

The issue is that if e.g. the user is able to perform the sign in with google, but afterwards is unable to successfully send the authorization code to my server for whatever reason, I am unable to obtain the refresh token anymore.
The user would need to revoke access and then try again which would be a terrible user experience.

Is there a way to force the consent prompt to come up?

title: Apple Watch app detection does not work for new Apple Watch projects

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

1. Create an Apple Watch app for a Flutter iOS app
2. Attempt to run the app

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
Flutter detects that the project contains an Apple Watch app and adjusts the build settings accordingly

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
Flutter cannot detect that new Apple Watch targets created by Xcode exist because the structure of Apple Watch targets changed. The build fails.

**Details**
Currently, Flutter looks for a `WKCompanionAppBundleIdentifier` key in plist files, but that key no longer exists in new Apple Watch projects.

The `watchkitapp` target no longer contains a plist by default, and the `watchkitextension` target contains a plist with the following contents:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
	<key>NSExtension</key>
	<dict>
		<key>NSExtensionAttributes</key>
		<dict>
			<key>WKAppBundleIdentifier</key>
			<string>dev.rexios.watchConnectivityExample.watchkitapp</string>
		</dict>
		<key>NSExtensionPointIdentifier</key>
		<string>com.apple.watchkit</string>
	</dict>
</dict>
</plist>
```

No idea how to reproduce, I'm refactoring code made by someone else, and figured with the request above it was a good idea to create the issue here as requested.

title: PopupMenuButton issues

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body: ## Use case I am using PopupMenuButton to display a list of suggestions to the user so that they can select from the suggestions. We should use PopupMenuItem to display each suggestion as required by PopupMenuButton. However, the width of the PopupMenuItem is not expanding to fit the entire screen regardless of my approach to wrap it with - SizedBox or Container with max width of the screen, The width of the suggestion list is somewhat fixed by default which prevents it from taking the available space. I found more about it in this issue : https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/92591#issuecomment-953417550 Also, The safeArea[ top-bottom ] of PopupMenuButton cannot be removed. This can be registered as a separate issue but I left it here in the same one for consideration. I cannot find a solution for this issue yet. ## Proposal Flutter should provide a default way for PopupMenuItem to adjust to the full screen width by: - Using a boolean value that might be called setFullScreenWith On setFullScreenWith value set to true , the PopupMenuItem takes the full width of the screen, else it will have the default property.

title: [google_maps_flutter] Adding label field to the marker

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Hi, 

Can label be added to the `Marker` 

```
const Marker({
    required this.markerId,
    this.alpha = 1.0,
    this.anchor = const Offset(0.5, 1.0),
    this.consumeTapEvents = false,
    this.draggable = false,
    this.flat = false,
    this.icon = BitmapDescriptor.defaultMarker,
    this.infoWindow = InfoWindow.noText,
    this.position = const LatLng(0.0, 0.0),
    this.rotation = 0.0,
    this.visible = true,
    this.zIndex = 0.0,
    this.onTap,
    this.onDrag,
    this.onDragStart,
    this.onDragEnd,
  }) : assert(alpha == null || (0.0 <= alpha && alpha <= 1.0));
```

It seems that this is available in the google maps documentation

https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/examples/marker-labels

dependency_overrides:

dependency_overrides:

title: Flutter doesn't consistently reach 120 fps on macOS

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Similar to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/90675, support 120 hz / ProMotion on the macOS platform.

EDIT: Flutter does appear to support 120 fps on macOS, but doesn't consistently reach it. See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/97530#issuecomment-1028590690.

title: After android studio update [Bumblebee | 2021.1.1] iOS can no longer be run from IDE, resulting in CocoaPods plugin error

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Both me and my colleague updated Android Studio to Bumblebee 2021.1.1 and got the same issue. 
I went from intl to Apple silicon, but she went from intl to intl.
We can build from the command line using `flutter build ipa` or `flutter run ios`.
Using `CMD+R` however cases the following cocoapods error.

```
Warning: CocoaPods not installed. Skipping pod install.
  CocoaPods is used to retrieve the iOS and macOS platform side's plugin code that responds to your plugin usage on the Dart side.
  Without CocoaPods, plugins will not work on iOS or macOS.
  For more info, see https://flutter.dev/platform-plugins
To install see https://guides.cocoapods.org/using/getting-started.html#installation for instructions.

CocoaPods not installed or not in valid state.
Error launching application on iPhone 13.
```

title: (Android) Doesn't load images from gallery when launch mode is in singleInstance

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
Hi there. Congrats for this excellent plugin, it has been a most have in all of my project. However, I have encountered an issue in Android devices when your declare in your main activity android:launchMode="singleInstance" instead of singleTop like the default config. Images from the default files app have no problems, however, if you switch to your gallery app, then images are not loaded after selection. ImagePicker.pickImage() just returns null. 

## Steps to Reproduce
Just go to your android/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml and change the lauchmode options. Should be something like this:
``` xml
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
   ...
   <application
        ...
        <activity
          android:name="com.yalantis.ucrop.UCropActivity"
          android:screenOrientation="portrait"
          android:theme="@style/Theme.AppCompat.Light.NoActionBar"
        />
        <activity
            android:name=".MainActivity"
            android:launchMode="singleInstance"
            android:theme="@style/LaunchTheme"
            android:configChanges="orientation|keyboardHidden|keyboard|screenSize|smallestScreenSize|locale|layoutDirection|fontScale|screenLayout|density|uiMode"
            android:hardwareAccelerated="true"
            android:windowSoftInputMode="adjustResize">
```
Would be great to give some alternative to this feature...maybe it's something that we must include in the activity and I'm missing.

title: [webview] WebView not parsing and rendering contents until visible

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body: Hi, this is a follow-up to [another issue](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/95938), discussed with @darshankawar. This issue was not clearly spotted, so I took more time on a small test project. I now have more precisely qualified the issue. The sample project is here: https://github.com/Mantano/pagination_tests, in branch [Simplified](https://github.com/Mantano/pagination_tests/tree/simplified: this one uses webview_flutter) In my sample project, 6 webviews are placed in a [PreloadPageView](https://pub.dev/packages/preload_page_view). This PreloadPageView allows defining how many pages are preloaded (`preloadPagesCount` param). I see this, in the chrome devtools: And when looking at one of the "empty - never attached" webviews: As you can see, the document has been parsed, but not pre-rendered ("empty - never attached"). As a consequence, if I add some JS code that does some computation based on the rendered contents, it will fail (as it does in our real ebook reader app). I'm pretty sure (100%) that this isn't a behavior induced by PreloadPageView, since the related code is exactly the same between the 2 branches. I hope these explanations are sufficiently precise. I'm pretty sure there is a simple fix. I'd like to continue using webview_flutter instead of flutter_inappwebview for many reasons... **EDIT** Please note that I am using Hybrid Composition on Android since it provides better performances, and it matches iOS where this is the only option available. But the issue doesn't occur on Android when using Virtual Display. Maybe this clue can also help? labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.description: flutter/plugins repository. See also p: labels.

labels.name: p: first party
labels.description: Plugins developed by the Flutter team.

labels.description: The Video Player plugin.

labels.name: has reproducible steps
labels.description: The issue is ready to work on.

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

labels.name: found in release: 2.8
labels.description: Found to occur in 2.8

labels.name: found in release: 2.10
labels.description: Found to occur in 2.10

body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the example code in https://github.com/flutter/plugins/tree/main/packages/video_player/video_player/example
2. Replace the video in _BumbleBeeRemoteVideoState::initState to 'https://test-streams.mux.dev/x36xhzz/x36xhzz.m3u8'
3. Run the demo on iOS device or iOS simulator (in Android works fine)
4. On the first tap, you can see the video square because the width and the height are zero

**Expected results:** Correct aspect ratio
**Actual results:** Square aspect ratio

## What I found

I tried to find the problem and it started on version video_player-v2.2.12
The problem is in the file FLTVideoPlayerPlugin in setupEventSinkIfReadyToPlay
```
if (hasVideoTracks && height == CGSizeZero.height && width == CGSizeZero.width) {
    return;
}
```
if the 'hasVideoTracks' is removed (as it was on version 2.2.11), the video looks fine and you can get the right width and height. If not, you always get zero in width and height

title: TODO workflow improvement idea

labels.name: r: duplicate
labels.description: Issue is closed as a duplicate of an existing issue

body:
## Use case

There is a [flutter_style_todos](https://dart-lang.github.io/linter/lints/flutter_style_todos.html) rule and as I understand, it is designed to help with `TODO` comment audit. This comment style is used in Flutter code base.


## Proposal

I just have an idea which might improve `TODO` audit workflow. Instead of using `TODO(user-name)` comment as the linter rule suggests we may use `TODO(issue-labels)` comment, for example:

- `TODO(blocked)` -  The issue is blocked on third-party code or team
- `TODO(performance)` - Performance issue
- `TODO(tools)` -Tooling related issue
- `TODO(platform-web-performance)` - Web platform performance issue
- `TODO(easy-ux)` - Easy user experience related issue
- `TODO(code-smell)` - Code that needs refactoring

This is just a workflow idea which I started to use in my projects. Please feel free to if you think that it will not make Flutter workflow more effective.
